{{ja-kanjitab|すい|かん|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
Appears to be a Japanese coinage using elements borrowed from {{etyl|ltc|-}}, as a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=すいかん|水|tr1=sui|t1=water|干|tr2=kan|t2=dry}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|すいかん|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|すいかん}}

# [[cloth]] that has been [[stretched]] and [[dried]] using only water and no [[starch]]
# an [[informal]] [[garment]] worn by males of the Japanese [[nobility]] in the [[w:Heian period|Heian period]], originally made from such cloth
# the [[edge]] of the [[water]], the [[shoreline]], the [[waterside]]
